TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr E. Cinmen , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) did not designate an Agent for the purposes of the proceedings before the ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant and PERSON were arrested and taken to ORG in GPE on suspicion of embezzlement . During his police custody , the applicant was allegedly subjected to illtreatment .
On DATE the applicant was examined by a medical expert , PERSON , at the FAC branch of ORG . The medical expert noted that there was no sign of ill - treatment on the applicant 's body .
The applicant was released on DATE . Without submitting any medical reports , the applicant states that , following his release , he went to ORG .

On DATE the applicant filed a petition with the ORG public prosecutor 's office , stating that he had been subjected to ill - treatment during his police custody at ORG , and requested to be referred to ORG for an examination . In his petition , he maintained that he had been subjected to falaka ( beating of the soles of the feet ) , that he had been hung from his arms , and that electric shocks had been administered to his body through his right toe , feet and his sexual organ . The applicant further maintained that he had also been forced to jump up and down and clean the floors in FAC .
On DATE , ORG sent the applicant to the FAC branch of ORG . The applicant was examined once again by PERSON , who noted the following :

“ ... A CARDINAL x QUANTITY old scabbed wound on the proximal phalanx of the right toe , a QUANTITY old scabbed wound on the inner side of the malleolus on the left foot , DATE CARDINAL x QUANTITY hyperaemia on the right armpit and an old QUANTITY hyperaemia on the left armpit were observed . ”
The doctor concluded that the applicant was unfit for work for DATE .

Again on DATE , the applicant applied to the GPE branch of ORG of GPE and he was examined by another doctor . The applicant maintained before the doctor that he had been beaten , subjected to falaka , hung from his arms and that electric shocks had been administered to his body through his right toe , feet and his sexual organs . He further stated that his testicles had been squeezed and a truncheon or an unknown object had been inserted into his anus . Subsequently , he alleged that he had been forced to jump up and down . According to the doctor 's report , the applicant was anxious . In his report , the doctor noted the following : a scabbed skin lesion of QUANTITY in diameter on the proximal phalanx of the right toe , a CARDINAL x QUANTITY hyperaemic skin lesion on the left shoulder , a purple coloured CARDINAL x QUANTITY ecchymosed skin lesion on the left armpit , CARDINAL parallel ecchymosed skin lesions of CARDINAL x QUANTITY and QUANTITY on the right armpit , a hyperaemic skin lesion of QUANTITY in diameter on the left ankle , an oedema under the left foot , a dark coloured hyperaemia on the metatarsal bone and a QUANTITY purple coloured ecchymosed skin lesion under the right foot .
Following further examinations , the medical expert concluded that the applicant suffered from plexopathy ( nerve damage ) in his left arm , anal fissure and anxiety .

On DATE the applicant gave a statement before the GPE public prosecutor . He alleged that during his custody he had been stripped naked , blindfolded , and subjected to falaka . He also stated that he had been hung from his arms and electric shocks had been administrated on his body . The applicant further maintained that he had not been examined by a doctor on DATE and that he had not filed a complaint on DATE as the police officers had threatened him . He explained that he had gone to ORG following his release from custody . He finally maintained that he would not be able to identify the officers who had tortured him as he had been blindfolded during the administration of ill - treatment .
On DATE the GPE public prosecutor took statements from GPE and GPE , who had taken the applicant 's statement on DATE . The police officers denied that they had ill - treated the applicant .
On DATE the GPE public prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG against GPE and ORG The charges were brought under LAW and the police officers were accused of having ill - treated the applicant .

On DATE ORG held the first hearing . The applicant joined the proceedings as a civil party ( müdahil ) and reiterated his statements that he had made before the public prosecutor . The court also heard the accused police officers , who once again denied the charges against them .

On DATE ORG held the second hearing in the case and heard the applicant 's father and PERSON as witnesses . The applicant 's father maintained that after his son was released from custody he had marks on his body which indicated that he had been severely beaten . PERSON also contended that , when he had seen the applicant after his interrogation at ORG , he had injuries on his body which indicated that he had been beaten .

During the hearing , the public prosecutor requested that an expert report be obtained from ORG in order to eliminate the discrepancy between the reports of CARDINAL and DATE . His request was dismissed by the first - instance court .
On DATE , ORG acquitted the accused police officers , finding that there was insufficient evidence to convict them .

On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of the first - instance court , holding that the latter should have heard the medical expert , PERSON , as a witness in order to eliminate the inconsistency between the CARDINAL medical reports that he had drafted .
On DATE ORG issued a summons requiring PERSON to give evidence on DATE .

On DATE PERSON attended at the court and informed it that she would not be in GPE on DATE . The first - instance court proceeded to hear her in the absence of the applicant and his representative . Before the court , the doctor maintained , inter alia , that there was no inconsistency between the CARDINAL reports and that the applicant 's injuries were sustained after his release on DATE .

In the next hearing held on DATE , the statement of Dr PERSON was read out to the applicant 's representative and he was requested to submit his replies . The applicant 's lawyer stated that he objected to the statement of the doctor and requested time to prepare his written submissions .

On an unspecified date , the applicant submitted to the first - instance court an expert report dated DATE , drawn up by CARDINAL forensic medicine experts from ORG . The doctors opined that the report of DATE was inadequate and concluded that the applicant might have sustained the injuries DATE prior to CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE ORG requested ORG to submit its opinion as to the date on which the applicant had possibly sustained the injuries in question .

On DATE CARDINAL experts from ORG submitted that it was not possible to identify the exact timing of the injuries on the applicant 's right toe and on his left foot ; however , it was stated that they might have occurred DATE . As regards the hyperaemic skin lesions described in the report of DATE , the experts opined that as such lesions would disappear within TIME ; it was not medically possible that they had been sustained before DATE . Furthermore , referring to the injuries to the applicant 's armpit , the doctors concluded that it was not possible to assess when they had occurred .

On DATE , having regard to the witness statements and the medical reports , ORG acquitted the accused police officers . It held , inter alia , that in view of the report of ORG , it was not possible to determine when the applicant had sustained the injuries in question and that there was therefore insufficient evidence to conclude that GPE and ORG had actually committed the offence that they were charged with .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court .
